Along with Lawrence Clark Powell, Ward Ritchie has become an important memoirist of the era in which he played such an important role. This chapter, the previous chapter, and the following chapter have drawn extensively upon Ritchie's writings, augmented by personal interviews, for numerous details and interpretations. In 1961 Ritchie produced the extensive memoir and bibliography The Ward Ritchie Press and Anderson
Between 1964 and 1966 Elizabeth I. Dixon interviewed Ritchie for the UCLA Oral History Program. The resulting volume, "Printing and Publishing in Southern California
is a gold mine of researched and cross-checked information which Ritchie himself has drawn upon for subsequent essays and addresses
